intro: Xantolis stenosepala var. brevistylis, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled xantolis, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive floral morphology, featuring narrow sepals and short, stylized petals. The plant typically thrives in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests, where it relies on specific microclimatic conditions for survival. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations to its ecological niche and its role in local biodiversity. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
